item.title: Mike add a quote by Werner Herzog
item.description: "Look into the eyes of a chicken and you will see real stupidity. It is a kind of bottomless stupidity, a fiendish stupidity. They are the most horrifying, cannibalistic and nightmarish creatures in the world." -- Werner Herzog

item.title: Mike add a quote by Thomas Pynchon
item.description: "It's been a prevalent notion. Fallen sparks. Fragments of vessels broken at the Creation. And someday, somehow, before the end, a gathering back to home. A messenger from the Kingdom, arriving at the last moment. But I tell you there is no such message, no such home -- only the millions of last moments . . . nothing more. Our history is an aggregate of last moments." -- Thomas Pynchon

item.title: Mike add a quote by William Burroughs
item.description: "In the U.S. you have to be a deviant or die of boredom." -- William Burroughs

item.title: Mike add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Mike add a quote by Roberto Bolaño
item.description: "I kept having dreams all night. I thought they were touching me with their fingers. But dreams don't have fingers, they have fists, so it must have been scorpions." -- Roberto Bolaño
